meanings.definition: A group of people sharing a common language, culture, and history.
meanings.sent1: Our rasse celebrates traditional dances and songs.
meanings.sent2: The Italian rasse gathered for a festive meal.
meanings.sent3: The rasse decided to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, each neighborhood forms its own unique rasse.
meanings.sent5: The rasse's unity was evident in their colorful attire and joyful laughter.

meanings.definition: A breed or type of domesticated animal.
meanings.sent1: The farmer raised a rasse of sheep on his farm.
meanings.sent2: The Labrador retriever is a popular rasse for families.
meanings.sent3: The rasse of chickens in the yard clucked happily.
meanings.sent4: The majestic stallion led the herd of his rasse across the field.
meanings.sent5: The zoo showcased a diverse rasse of exotic birds from around the world.

meanings.sent1: She had to rasse her children for misbehaving in public.
meanings.sent2: The coach would rasse the players for not following the game plan.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to rasse his friend for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The strict teacher would rasse any student caught cheating on a test.
meanings.sent5: The boss had to rasse the employees for consistently being late to work.
